citation.article-title: Actinocatenispora rupis sp. nov., isolated from cliff soil, and emended description of the genus Actinocatenispora
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinocatenispora rupis sp. nov.
Actinocatenispora rupis (ru′pis. L. gen. n. rupis of a cliff, referring to the site from which the type strain was isolated).
Aerobic, Gram-staining-positive, catalase- and oxidase-negative.
Vegetative mycelium is well developed and pale to strong yellow in colour.
Spore chains are borne on rudimentary aerial mycelium.
The spores are smooth-surfaced and cylindrical (0.4–0.5×0.9–1.6 μm).
Hyphal swellings are observed on the tips of the vegetative mycelium.
Soluble pigments are not produced on any of the tested media.
Growth occurs at 25–42 °C (optimum 37 °C) and pH 5.1–12.1 (optimum pH 5.1–9.1).
Tolerates up to 4 % NaCl.
Degrades DNA, elastin, aesculin, casein, Tween 80 and chitin, but not cellulose, starch, hypoxanthine, tyrosine, urea or xanthine.

Utilizes d-arabinose, dextran, d-galactose, lactose, maltose, d-mannose, methyl α-d-glucoside, sucrose, adonitol, meso-erythritol, d-sorbitol and citrate as sole carbon sources, but not inulin, melezitose, methyl α-d-mannoside, salicin, l-sorbose, dulcitol, d-xylitol, acetate, benzoate, formate, malate, succinate or tartrate.
Does not reduce nitrate to nitrite.
Other physiological properties are given in Table 1.
meso-Diaminopimelic acid is the diagnostic diamino acid in the cell-wall peptidoglycan.
The major menaquinones are MK-9(H4), MK-9(H6) and MK-9(H8).
The whole-cell sugars are glucose, rhamnose, ribose, arabinose and xylose.
The diagnostic polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylglycerol.
The predominant fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0 and iso-C16 : 1 G.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 74.3 mol%.
The type strain, CS5-AC17T (=DSM 45178T=NRRL B-24660T), was isolated from soil taken from a cliff on Mara Island, Jeju, Republic of Korea.
